services.name: AWS Lambda
services.documentation: AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume. Lambda automatically scales your application by running code in response to triggers.
services.billingModel: Pay per request and compute duration

services.name: Amazon EC2
services.documentation: Amazon EC2 provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It allows you to launch virtual servers, configure security and networking, and manage storage. EC2 offers various instance types optimized for different use cases.
services.billingModel: Pay per hour or second of instance usage

services.name: Amazon S3
services.documentation: Amazon S3 is object storage built to store and retrieve any amount of data. It offers industry-leading durability, availability, performance, security, and virtually unlimited scalability at very low costs.

services.name: Amazon DynamoDB
services.documentation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. It supports both document and key-value data models.
services.billingModel: Pay per read/write capacity units or on-demand
services.costHint: On-demand: $1.25 per million write units, $0.25 per million read units

services.name: Amazon API Gateway
services.documentation: Amazon API Gateway is a fully managed service for creating, publishing, maintaining, monitoring, and securing REST, HTTP, and WebSocket APIs. It handles traffic management, authorization, and API versioning.
services.billingModel: Pay per API call + data transfer

services.name: Amazon CloudFront
services.documentation: Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency and high transfer speeds.

services.name: Amazon RDS
services.documentation: Amazon RDS makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, and SQL Server with automated backups and patching.

services.name: Amazon Cognito
services.documentation: Amazon Cognito provides authentication, authorization, and user management for web and mobile apps. Users can sign in directly with a username and password or through third parties like Facebook, Google, or Amazon.

services.name: Amazon SQS
services.documentation: Amazon SQS is a fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple and scale microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications.

services.name: Amazon SNS
services.documentation: Amazon SNS is a fully managed pub/sub messaging service for application-to-application and application-to-person communication. It supports SMS, email, and push notifications.
services.costHint: ~$0.50 per million publishes, SMS varies by country

services.name: Amazon EventBridge
services.shortDescription: Serverless event bus for application integration
services.documentation: Amazon EventBridge is a serverless event bus that connects applications using events from AWS services, SaaS apps, and custom sources.

services.name: Amazon Kinesis
services.documentation: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time streaming data for timely insights.

services.name: Amazon Athena
services.documentation: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in S3 using standard SQL.

services.name: Amazon Rekognition
services.documentation: Amazon Rekognition makes it easy to add image and video analysis to your applications using deep learning.

services.name: Amazon Bedrock
services.documentation: Amazon Bedrock is a fully managed service offering foundation models from leading AI companies via a single API.

services.name: Amazon SageMaker
services.shortDescription: Build, train, and deploy ML models
services.documentation: Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service to build, train, and deploy machine learning models at scale.

services.name: Amazon ECS
services.documentation: Amazon ECS is a fully managed container orchestration service for running Docker containers.
services.billingModel: Pay for underlying EC2 or Fargate

services.name: AWS Fargate
services.documentation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that works with ECS and EKS.
services.billingModel: Pay per vCPU and memory per second

services.name: Amazon ECR
services.documentation: Amazon ECR is a fully managed Docker container registry for storing, managing, and deploying container images.
services.billingModel: Pay per GB stored + data transfer

services.name: Amazon EKS
services.documentation: Amazon EKS is a managed Kubernetes service to run Kubernetes on AWS without managing the control plane.

services.name: Elastic Load Balancing
services.documentation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets.

services.name: Amazon Route 53
services.documentation: Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable DNS web service for domain registration and routing.

services.name: Amazon VPC
services.documentation: Amazon VPC lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud with your own virtual network.

services.name: AWS IAM
services.documentation: AWS IAM enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely with users, groups, and roles.

services.name: AWS KMS
services.documentation: AWS KMS makes it easy to create and manage cryptographic keys for encrypting your data.

services.name: AWS WAF
services.documentation: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications from common exploits.
services.billingModel: Pay per web ACL + rules + requests

services.name: AWS Secrets Manager
services.documentation: AWS Secrets Manager helps you protect secrets needed to access your applications, services, and IT resources.

services.name: Amazon CloudWatch
services.documentation: Amazon CloudWatch monitors your AWS resources and applications, collecting metrics, logs, and events.

services.name: AWS CodePipeline
services.documentation: AWS CodePipeline is a continuous delivery service for fast and reliable application updates.

services.name: AWS CodeBuild
services.documentation: AWS CodeBuild is a fully managed build service that compiles source code, runs tests, and produces packages.

services.name: AWS CloudFormation
services.documentation: AWS CloudFormation lets you model and provision AWS resources using templates.

services.name: AWS Step Functions
services.documentation: AWS Step Functions lets you coordinate multiple AWS services into serverless workflows.

services.name: AWS Glue
services.documentation: AWS Glue is a serverless data integration service for discovering, preparing, and combining data.

services.name: Amazon Redshift
services.documentation: Amazon Redshift is a fast, scalable data warehouse for analyzing data across your data warehouse and data lake.

services.name: Amazon QuickSight
services.documentation: Amazon QuickSight is a fast, cloud-powered business intelligence service for building visualizations and dashboards.

services.name: Amazon EBS
services.documentation: Amazon EBS provides persistent block storage volumes for use with EC2 instances.

services.name: Amazon EFS
services.documentation: Amazon EFS provides a simple, scalable, elastic file system for Linux-based workloads.

services.name: Amazon S3 Glacier
services.documentation: Amazon S3 Glacier is a secure, durable, and low-cost storage class for data archiving and long-term backup.

services.name: AWS Amplify
services.shortDescription: Build full-stack web and mobile apps
services.documentation: AWS Amplify is a set of tools and services for building scalable full-stack web and mobile applications.

services.name: AWS AppSync
services.documentation: AWS AppSync is a managed GraphQL service for building data-driven apps with real-time and offline capabilities.

services.name: AWS IoT Core
services.shortDescription: Connect IoT devices to the cloud
services.documentation: AWS IoT Core lets you connect IoT devices to AWS services without managing servers.

services.name: Amazon Connect
services.documentation: Amazon Connect is an easy-to-use cloud contact center service for customer engagement.

services.name: Amazon Lex
services.documentation: Amazon Lex provides advanced deep learning for building conversational interfaces using voice and text.

services.name: Amazon Polly
services.documentation: Amazon Polly turns text into lifelike speech, allowing you to create applications that talk.

services.name: Amazon Transcribe
services.documentation: Amazon Transcribe is an automatic speech recognition service for adding speech-to-text capability.

services.name: Amazon Comprehend
services.documentation: Amazon Comprehend is a natural language processing service for finding insights and relationships in text.

services.name: Amazon Translate
services.documentation: Amazon Translate is a neural machine translation service for fast, high-quality language translation.

services.name: Amazon Textract
services.documentation: Amazon Textract automatically extracts text, handwriting, and data from scanned documents.

services.name: Amazon Personalize
services.documentation: Amazon Personalize enables developers to build applications with real-time personalized recommendations.

services.name: Amazon Forecast
services.documentation: Amazon Forecast is a fully managed service for accurate time-series forecasting using machine learning.

services.name: AWS Auto Scaling
services.documentation: AWS Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain performance.
services.costHint: No charge for Auto Scaling itself

services.name: Amazon ElastiCache
services.documentation: Amazon ElastiCache is a fully managed in-memory caching service supporting Redis and Memcached.

services.name: Amazon DocumentDB
services.documentation: Amazon DocumentDB is a fast, scalable, highly available MongoDB-compatible document database service.
services.billingModel: Pay per instance hour + storage + I/O

services.name: Amazon Neptune
services.documentation: Amazon Neptune is a fast, reliable, fully managed graph database service for highly connected datasets.
services.billingModel: Pay per instance hour + storage + I/O

services.name: Amazon Timestream
services.documentation: Amazon Timestream is a fast, scalable, serverless time series database for IoT and operational applications.

services.name: Amazon MSK
services.documentation: Amazon MSK is a fully managed service for Apache Kafka to build and run streaming data applications.

services.name: Amazon OpenSearch
services.documentation: Amazon OpenSearch Service makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale OpenSearch for log analytics and search.

services.name: AWS DMS
services.documentation: AWS Database Migration Service helps you migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely.

services.name: AWS Snowball
services.documentation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transport solution using physical storage devices.

services.name: Amazon WorkSpaces
services.documentation: Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed desktop computing service for provisioning cloud-based desktops.

services.name: Amazon Chime
services.documentation: Amazon Chime is a communications service for online meetings, video conferencing, and business calling.

services.name: AWS Elemental MediaLive
services.documentation: AWS Elemental MediaLive is a broadcast-grade live video processing service for creating high-quality video streams.

services.name: Amazon Managed Blockchain
services.documentation: Amazon Managed Blockchain is a fully managed service for creating and managing blockchain networks.

services.name: Amazon Braket
services.documentation: Amazon Braket is a fully managed quantum computing service for researchers and developers.

patterns.label: Serverless REST API with Database
patterns.summary: Build a scalable REST API without managing servers. Perfect for web and mobile backends with automatic scaling.
patterns.costSummary: Very low cost for low-medium traffic. Pay only for actual usage.
securityNotes: Use IAM roles for Lambda, never hardcode credentials
Enable API Gateway authorization with Cognito or API keys
Enable DynamoDB encryption at rest

patterns.label: Static Website Hosting
patterns.summary: Host a fast, secure static website with global CDN distribution. Ideal for portfolios, landing pages, and SPAs.
patterns.costSummary: Extremely low cost. Often under $1/month for small sites.
securityNotes: Enable HTTPS via CloudFront SSL certificate
Block public S3 access, use CloudFront OAI
Consider WAF for DDoS protection

patterns.label: AI Image Analysis Pipeline
patterns.summary: Automatically analyze images using AI for object detection, facial analysis, and content moderation.
patterns.costSummary: Pay per image analyzed. Cost-effective for moderate volumes.
securityNotes: Use IAM roles with least privilege for Rekognition access
Encrypt S3 bucket with SSE-S3 or SSE-KMS
Consider data privacy regulations for facial data

patterns.label: Real-time Notifications System
patterns.summary: Send real-time notifications via SMS, email, or push. Perfect for alerts, updates, and user engagement.
patterns.costSummary: Very low cost. SMS charges vary by country.
securityNotes: Use SNS topic policies to restrict publishers
Enable encryption for SQS queues
Validate message content before processing

patterns.label: Data Analytics Pipeline
patterns.summary: Ingest, process, and analyze streaming data. Build dashboards and run SQL queries on your data lake.
patterns.costSummary: Costs scale with data volume. Athena charges per query.
securityNotes: Encrypt data at rest in S3 and Kinesis
Use IAM policies to control Athena query access
Enable CloudTrail for audit logging

patterns.label: Containerized Application
patterns.summary: Deploy containerized applications with automatic scaling. Great for microservices architecture.
patterns.costSummary: Pay for compute resources. Fargate simplifies pricing.
securityNotes: Scan container images for vulnerabilities
Use task IAM roles, not instance roles
Enable VPC networking for isolation

patterns.label: Generative AI Chatbot
patterns.summary: Build an AI-powered chatbot using foundation models. Create conversational experiences with generative AI.
patterns.costSummary: Pay per token processed. Costs vary by model.
securityNotes: Implement input validation to prevent prompt injection
Use IAM to restrict Bedrock model access
Consider content filtering for responses

patterns.label: User Authentication System
patterns.summary: Implement secure user authentication with social login support. Manage users without building auth from scratch.
patterns.costSummary: Free for first 50K users. Very cost-effective.
securityNotes: Enable MFA for sensitive applications
Use secure password policies
Implement proper token validation

trendingTopics.label: Generative AI & ML
trendingTopics.description: Build intelligent applications with foundation models, image recognition, and natural language processing.

trendingTopics.label: Serverless First
trendingTopics.description: Build and run applications without managing servers. Pay only for what you use.

trendingTopics.label: Containers & Kubernetes
trendingTopics.description: Package and deploy applications consistently using Docker containers and orchestration.

trendingTopics.label: Real-Time Streaming
trendingTopics.description: Process and analyze data in real-time for instant insights and actions.

trendingTopics.label: Data Lake & Analytics
trendingTopics.description: Store, process, and analyze massive amounts of data for business intelligence.

trendingTopics.label: Zero Trust Security
trendingTopics.description: Implement modern security practices with identity-based access control.

trendingTopics.label: Edge & CDN
trendingTopics.description: Deliver content and compute at the edge for low latency global performance.

trendingTopics.label: IoT Workloads
trendingTopics.description: Connect, manage, and process data from Internet of Things devices.
